item.title: Trump Says There’s a Buyer for TikTok But Won’t Divulge Name
item.description: President Donald Trump said he has identified a buyer for the US operations of TikTok social media app owned by Chinese company ByteDance Ltd., but he won’t provide details for two weeks.
item.dc:creator: Hadriana Lowenkron, Maria Paula Mijares Torres

media:content.media:description: The TikTok app page in the Google Play store on a smartphone arranged in the Queens borough of New York, US, on Wednesday, Jan. 15, 2025. The Supreme Court signaled it's likely to uphold a law that would ban the popular TikTok social media platform in the US if it isn't sold by its Chinese parent company by Jan. 19.

item.title: Australia Startups Starved of Cash Despite Big Potential Returns
item.description: Australian startups lag far behind the US and China in funding raised despite the country’s historical effectiveness at creating unicorns.
item.dc:creator: Benicia Tan

media:content.media:description: A design template displayed on monitors at the Canva headquarters in Sydney. Photographer: Brent Lewin/Bloomberg

item.title: Apple Should Sell a Smart Ring to Expand Its Fitness Tracker Lineup
item.description: Apple should seriously consider developing a smart ring to give its fitness-tracking wearables push new momentum and widen its market. Also: The company hints at a tethered Vision Pro, and there are new beta versions of iOS 26 and other operating systems.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

item.title: Fist-Pumping Humanoid Robots Play Soccer Badly in Beijing
item.description: They looked like tipsy 7-year-olds stumbling about the soccer pitch. But the game that unfolded at an industrial zone in Beijing was a breakthrough for humanoid robots and the artificial intelligence that powered them through a 5-3 match on Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Saritha Rai

media:content.media:description: BEIJING, CHINA - JUNE 28: Humanoid robot football players compete in the match between Shanhai team of China Agricultural University and Tsinghua Hephaestus Team from Tsinghua University during the inaugural domestic 3v3 AI-powered robot football match, the first test event of the 2025 World Humanoid Robot Games, on June 28, 2025 in Beijing, China. This is a competition with zero human remote control, where robots make fully autonomous decisions and demonstrate intelligent communication and teamwork. (Photo by Zhang Xiangyi/China News Service/VCG via AP )

item.title: DOJ Settles Merger Case Over HPE’s $13 Billion Juniper Deal
item.description: The Justice Department settled its lawsuit challenging Hewlett Packard Enterprise’s $13 billion takeover of Juniper Networks, less than two weeks before a trial was set to start.
item.dc:creator: Josh Sisco

media:content.media:description: Hewlett Packard Enterprise headquarters in Spring, Texas, US, on Monday, May 29, 2023. Hewlett Packard Enterprise is scheduled to release earnings figures on June 1.

item.title: Meta Taps Four OpenAI Researchers for Superintelligence Team
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. has hired four notable artificial intelligence researchers from OpenAI, ramping up a hiring spree for its Superintelligence group.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman, Kurt Wagner

media:content.media:description: Meta headquarters in Menlo Park, California, US, on Tuesday, Jan 28, 2025. Meta Platforms Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on January 29. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Canada Orders Hikvision to Cease Local Operations
item.description: Canadian Industry Minister Melanie Joly said her government ordered Hikvision Canada to cease all operations in the country and close its business.
item.dc:creator: Yi Wei Wong

media:content.media:description: Surveillance cameras manufactured by Hangzhou Hikvision Digital Technology Co. are mounted on a post at a testing station near the company's headquarters in Hangzhou, China, on Tuesday, May 28, 2019. Hikvision, which is controlled by the Chinese government, is one of the leaders in the market for surveillance technology, with cameras that can produce sharp, full-color images in fog and near-total darkness. Photographer: Qilai Shen/Bloomberg

item.title: The Biotech Start-Up Making Vaccines for Bees and Shrimp
item.description: A first for insects in the US.
item.dc:creator: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal

item.title: Odd Lots: The Biotech Making Bee and Shrimp Vaccines (Podcast)
item.description: Think of a biotech company and most people will think of a business trying to come up with cures and treatments for human illnesses. There’s not a lot of discussion about companies trying to do the same for animals, insects, or even... crustaceans. And yet, healthy animals are a key part of the ecosystem and important for our food supply. In this episode, we speak to Annette Kleiser, CEO of Dalan Animal Health, which has developed the world’s first vaccine for bees and is now working on a simila
item.dc:creator: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal

item.title: TSMC Affiliate VIS May Expedite Production at $8 Billion Singapore Fab
item.description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.’s smaller affiliate Vanguard International Semiconductor Corp. may accelerate the chip production schedule at its new $7.8 billion joint venture in Singapore on greater customer demand for hedging against geopolitical risks.
item.dc:creator: Debby Wu

media:content.media:description: Buildings in Singapore, on Monday, March 10, 2025. Economists lowered the growth outlook for Singapore and Hong Kong in the second half of this year on increased uncertainties from US President Donald Trump imposing higher tariffs on China’s exports, according to the median of a Bloomberg survey. Photographer: Ore Huiying/Bloomberg
